pr_title: [JENKINS-61004, JENKINS-60299] - Reintroduce Build History description truncation by default, allow managing/disabling the limit via a system property

timeline.message: [JENKINS-61004] - Reintroduce Build History description truncation by default, allow managing/disabling the limit via a system property

timeline.bodyText: personally I would make 0 disable truncation as 0 often means unlimited, why introduce a feature to disable descriptions? has anyone asked for it?
timeline.author: timja

replies.bodyText: That was 2 possible solutions, didn't suggest implementing both 😉
replies.author: timja

replies.bodyText:
Hi, just wanted to chime in. I'm the one who created JENKINS-60299. For our use-case a possibility to disable the build description in the build history widget would be really nice. Note though that we very much need the build description for each build, just not in the widget itself.
Off course, I'm just one user so I understand if our specific need cannot be taken into account and implemented as a feature for all users :-)
replies.author: Laffs2k5

replies.bodyText: Seems like a reasonable option for people using non-HTML markup formatting, which is horrifically broken by the server-side, pre-transformation truncation.
replies.author: daniel-beck

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java b/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java
index c0a764f36f..12d4814697 100644
--- a/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java
+++ b/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java

@@ -679,8 +681,8 @@ public abstract class Run <JobT extends Job<JobT,RunT>,RunT extends Run<JobT,Run
 
     /**
      * Returns the length-limited description.
-     * The method tries to take the HTML tags into account, but it is a best-effort attempt.
-     * Also, the method will not work properly if a non-HTML {@link hudson.markup.MarkupFormatter} is used.
+     * The method tries to take HTML tags within the description into account, but it is a best-effort attempt.
+     * Also, the method will likely not work properly if a non-HTML {@link hudson.markup.MarkupFormatter} is used.
      * @return The length-limited description.
      * @deprecated truncated description based on the {@link #TRUNCATED_DESCRIPTION_LIMIT} setting.
      */

timeline.author: daniel-beck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -157,6 +157,13 @@
      */
     public static final long QUEUE_ID_UNKNOWN = -1;
 
+    /**
+     * Target size limit for truncated {@link #description}s in the Build History Widget.
+     * Negative values will disable truncation, {@code 0} will enforce empty strings.
+     * @since TODO
+     */
+    private static int TRUNCATED_DESCRIPTION_LIMIT = SystemProperties.getInteger("historyWidget.descriptionLimit", 100);

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java b/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java
index c0a764f36f..12d4814697 100644
--- a/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java
+++ b/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Run.java

@@ -159,10 +159,12 @@ public abstract class Run <JobT extends Job<JobT,RunT>,RunT extends Run<JobT,Run
 
     /**
      * Target size limit for truncated {@link #description}s in the Build History Widget.
+     * This is applied to the raw, unformatted description. Especially complex formatting
+     * like hyperlinks can result in much less text being shown than this might imply.
      * Negative values will disable truncation, {@code 0} will enforce empty strings.
      * @since TODO
      */
-    private static int TRUNCATED_DESCRIPTION_LIMIT = SystemProperties.getInteger("historyWidget.descriptionLimit", 100);
+    private static /* non-final for Groovy */ int TRUNCATED_DESCRIPTION_LIMIT = SystemProperties.getInteger("historyWidget.descriptionLimit", 100);
 
     protected transient final @Nonnull JobT project;

timeline.bodyText: The deprecation doesn't really make sense anymore? At least for a while?

replies.bodyText: I do not want to revert it for now, will probably act on that in a follow-up PR
